page.title: 19LITTLE ERNIE.
page.content: This is a weekly lottery named after the nickname given to the computer selecting the Premium Bond numbers. It was started before the current village hall was built to raise funds towards building costs. It has continued ever since (approx 10-12 years),and now the money is used to help finance the hall's improvements and maintenance. The draw is open to anyone for five a pence ticket.For each five pence a week,members are given a number with the chance of {winning Â£5 or two Â£1 prizes.}The draw takes place each Thursday afternoon during the over sixties club,and notices are placed around the village to announce the winners.
